name: Hidden Capitals Quiz | Geography Hidden Words | 10 Questions

questions.text: One stroke under par is the score I am hoping for.
questions.explanation:
Paris.

	One stroke under PAR IS the score I am hoping for. Paris is the capital city of France and is bisected into three parts by the  Seine River. Known as a center of high fashion, Paris is also known for its fantastic neoclassical architecture. It is also the epitome of why street planning works and is home to some of the most beautiful bridges in Europe.

questions.text: Alica ironed all her new shirts.
questions.explanation:
Cairo.

	AliCA IROned all her new shirts. Cairo is the capital of Egypt and was founded around 969CE.  It is the largest city in the Middle East and the second largest in Africa. Cairo is a mysterious city, bisected by the Nile River and home to thousands of ancient buildings and artifacts.

questions.text: The hobo got a new haircut.
questions.explanation:
Bogota.

	The hoBO GOT A new haircut. Founded in 1538, Bogota is the capital city of Colombia. This city sits at an altitude of 8,560 ft. (2,610m) in the center of the country. It is often referred to as "The Athens of South America".

questions.text: I only quit once in a while.
questions.explanation:
Quito.

	I only QUIT Once in a while. The country of Ecuador can claim to have the highest capital city on the planet with the city of Quito which lies at 9,350 ft. (2,850m) above sea level. Located just south of the equator, Quito is one of the best preserved cities on the continent.

questions.text: Susie got mad riding the elephant.
questions.explanation:
Madrid.

	Susie got MAD RIDing the elephant. Madrid is the capital of the European country of Spain. It is located on an area of high elevation in the center of the country. Madrid is known for its beautiful architecture and fine food.

questions.text: I think I eventually found the treasure.
questions.explanation:
Kiev.

	I thinK I EVentually found the treasure. The Ukrainian capital of Kiev sits on the Dnieper River in the north central part of the country. For centuries Kiev was an important trade route, until the marauding army of the Mongols completely destroyed the city in 1240. It was not until the 19th century that Kiev rose back to prominence.

questions.text: My nose started swelling to nine times its original size.
questions.explanation:
Wellington.

	My nose started sWELLING TO Nine times its original size. Wellington is the capital city of New Zealand and is located on the very bottom of the North Island. Wellington has one of the highest standards of living of any national capital in the world. Wellington is located in a picturesque natural harbor and has become a tourist spot in the early decades of the 21st century.

questions.text: Don't stick a bull in your kitchen.
questions.explanation:
Kabul.

	Don't sticK A BULl in your kitchen. Located in the northeastern part of the country, Kabul is the capital of Afghanistan. Kabul is one of the oldest world capitals, and has been the center of strife for many years. The city is a reflection of the numerous cultures which have influenced it throughout time.

questions.text: I need a wench, a noisy llama, and a pink dahlia.
questions.explanation:
Hanoi.

	I need a wencH A NOIsy llama, and a pink dahlia. Lying on the right bank of the Red River, Hanoi is the capital city of Vietnam. It started moving forward and urbanizing around the turn of the 21st century and is one of the fastest growing cities on the planet.

questions.text: Speaking of wine, a new tun is in the basement.
questions.explanation:
Tunis.

	Speaking of wine, a new TUN IS in the basement. Located on the Mediterranean Sea, Tunis is home to many ancient ruins and artifacts. The remains of the ancient city of Carthage can be seen during a visit to this beautiful capital city. Tunis is a nice mixture of the ancient past and the future to come.
